title: Romain Boutelet
text:
Quick bio
I am Romain Boutelet, a fourth year PhD student in the Department of Statistics and Probability at Michigan State University. I am very grateful to be advised by Dr. Chih-Li Sung, and to be part of the Finley Lab under the supervision of Dr. Andrew Finley.
My research interests include Computer Experiments and Uncertainty Quantification in the broad context of Engineering Sciences as well as Spatial Statistics.


News

[Oct 24] I will be presenting “Active Learning for Multi-Fidelity Computer Experiments with Different Mesh Densities” (slides) at the 2024 INFORMS Annual Meeting in Seattle, WA.
[Aug 24] I presented my work “Active Learning for Multi-Fidelity Computer Experiments with Different Mesh Densities” at the 2024 Joint Statistical Meetings in Portland, OR.
